alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Newberry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 7:36PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Fairfield, southeastern Newberry, central Lexington and northwestern Richland Counties through 815 PM EST... At 736 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Prosperity to 8 miles southeast of Batesburg-Leesville. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. ...Boaters on Lake Murray Should Seek Safe Harbor... HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, St. Andrews, Dentsville, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, South Congaree, Pine Ridge, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Harbison State Forest, Sesquicentennial State Park, Lake Carolina and SC State Fair Grounds. This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 42 and 81. Interstate 26 between mile markers 85 and 116. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 2, near mile marker 5, and between mile markers 9 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for central South Carolina.
